questions.title: Question 1
questions.text: What is the primary purpose of a rocket engine?

questions.title: Question 2
questions.text: Which of the following is a common propellant used in rocket engines?

questions.title: Question 3
questions.text: What does ISP stand for in rocketry?

questions.title: Question 4
questions.text: Which type of rocket engine uses both liquid fuel and liquid oxidizer?

questions.title: Question 5
questions.text: What is the function of the nozzle in a rocket engine?
choices: Control the flow of exhaust gases
questions.correctAnswer: Control the flow of exhaust gases

questions.title: What is a key advantage of using liquid rocket propellants?
questions.text: Higher specific impulse

questions.title: Question 7
questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a type of rocket propellant?

questions.title: Question 8
questions.text: What does the term 'thrust-to-weight ratio' refer to?
choices: The efficiency of the rocket engine
The amount of fuel burned per second
The ratio of thrust produced to the weight of the rocket
The maximum speed of the rocket
questions.correctAnswer: The ratio of thrust produced to the weight of the rocket

questions.title: Question 9
questions.text: What is the main purpose of the oxidizer in a rocket engine?

questions.title: Question 10
questions.text: Which part of the rocket engine controls the direction of the thrust?

questions.text: Bernoulli's principle helps to explain which aerodynamic concept?

questions.title: Question 4
questions.text: What happens to air pressure as it flows over the curved upper surface of an airfoil?

questions.text: The angle of attack is the angle between the chord line of an airfoil and which other reference?

questions.title: Question 6
questions.text: What is the effect of increasing the angle of attack beyond the critical angle?

questions.text: Which component of an aircraft primarily controls yaw?

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of winglets on an aircraft?
